item.title: Brigit add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Brigit add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Brigit add a quote by H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
item.description: "Approach love and cooking with reckless abandon" -- H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

item.title: Brigit add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "If a problem is fixable, if a situation is such that you can do something about it, then there is no need to worry. If it's not fixable, then there is no help in worrying. There is no benefit in worrying whatsoever." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Brigit add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "The purpose of all the major religious traditions is not to construct big temples on the outside, but to create temples of goodness and compassion inside, in our hearts." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Brigit add a quote by Colson Whitehead
item.description: "Isn't it great when you're a kid and the world is full of anonymous things? Everything is bright and mysterious until you know what it is called and then all the light goes out of it...Once we knew the name of it, how could we ever come to love it?...For things had true natures, and they hid behind false names, beneath the skin we gave them." -- Colson Whitehead
